definition: to walk at a slow, easy pace
example: We amble through the fields on summer days.

definition: a soft, thick, yellow leather made from the skin of a buffalo or ox
a stick or wheel covered with a soft cloth or piece of leather, used for cleaning or shining
a yellowish brown color
to clean or polish with a buff
example: My dad buffs his shoes every Sunday to make them look nice for the week.

definition: a television or radio station or frequency. If there is something on TV that you don't like, maybe you will change the channel so you can watch something different.
example: Mark's favorite TV channel is the sports channel. The sports channel shows all the games he likes to watch.

definition: a long, narrow body of water that connects two larger bodies of water. There are natural channels that connect bodies of water like seas and oceans, and there are smaller man-made channels also.
example: The English Channel is a body of water that lies between the countries of England and France. This channel connects the North Sea to the Atlantic Ocean.

definition: the deepest part of a body of water
example: They steered the heavy boat down the channel.

definition: a metal tool with a sharp edge used for carving or cutting stone, wood, or metal. Usually, you use a hammer or mallet to hit the top of the chisel, and the force of the hammer or mallet pushes the chisel into the hard material.
example: The letters of the man's named were carved into the stone with a hammer and chisel.

definition: land that forms a line next to an ocean. Houses and other buildings can be located on a coast.
example: Greg's grandparents have a house on the coast of the Atlantic Ocean. It is so close to the water that you can hear the waves from their front porch!

definition: a part of a country or continent that lies along an ocean. A coast can be hundreds or thousands of miles long. Towns and cities are often located on a coast.
example: The city of Los Angeles is on the west coast of the United States, and the city of New York is on the east coast.

definition: to move forward without using any energy. You can coast when you ride down a hill. When a car coasts down a hill, it doesn't use any gasoline.
example: It's fun to coast the whole way down the hill on my bike, but it's hard to ride back up!

definition: displaying confidence in a way that is boastful or arrogant
example: The other team members got tired of his cocky talk before the game.

definition: not simple. A complex thing has many parts, and they may be connected in various ways. A complex thing might operate according to many rules, but there may be many exceptions to the rules too.
example: A computer is a complex machine. English spelling is complex.

definition: difficult to understand because it is complicated
example: Mr. Cox tried to read a book his friend gave him, but he said it was too complex. It was complex because there were so many characters, and things were happening in both the past and the present and also in people's dreams.

definition: a hall with many rooms on either side. Hospitals, office buildings, schools, and hotels are some places that usually have corridors.
example: Our hotel room was at the end of a long corridor.

definition: to tear down or destroy
example: We demolished the old barn and built a new one. The car was demolished in the accident.

definition: to put up a building or other structure. To build it so that it stands.
example: The city erected a monument in memory of the city's soldiers who died in the war. The famous skyscraper was erected almost one hundred years ago.

definition: in a straight up or standing position. Not lying flat or bending over.
example: The fresh flowers are erect in the vase but the older flowers are starting to bend over. Dog's can stand in an erect position for a while, but it is not the most natural position for them. Max's piano teacher told him his back should be erect while sitting at the piano.

definition: to create a picture, design or lettering on a hard surface such as glass or metal by removing parts of the surface with acid
example: The artist etched a picture of a tree.

definition: a part of an ocean that has land almost all around it. A gulf is like a very large bay. It is also like some seas, but seas are usually bigger than gulfs.
example: The part of the Atlantic Ocean that touches the southern United States and Mexico is called the Gulf of Mexico.

definition: a deep crack in the earth's surface
example: The large gulf discovered in the East African desert is of interest to scientists studying earth's crust.

definition: a large difference
example: There is a gulf between what I think of as a clean room and what my mother thinks of as a clean room.

definition: having many complex parts, angles, or aspects; involved; elaborate
example: If you take the time, there is a lot to see in his intricate drawings.

definition: to move or be moved jerkily and unevenly; bounce
a jerky and uneven movement; bounce
to build or start (a fire)
example: The campers used twigs and matches to kindle a fire.

definition: to make excited; to inspire
example: That book kindled his interest in poetry.

definition: to start to burn; catch fire
example: The crumpled paper kindled.

definition: dry material that burns easily and is used to start a fire
to make something move into the air with a lot of force
example: They launched the rocket in the early morning.

definition: to put a boat in the water
example: Logan's dad launched his new boat in the lake for the first time last weekend.

definition: to start something, especially something that has taken a lot of work to prepare
example: Rebecca's mother is excited to launch her new project that she hopes will raise money for animal shelters.

definition: to start moving quickly upward or forward
example: The rocket launched into space.

definition: the act of sending something into the air with great force, or the act of starting something big or important
example: The launch of the rocket is planned for tomorrow. The launch of the new TV series takes place next week.

definition: done without hurrying and without feeling any pressure to get something done
example: The couple spent their vacation is a leisurely way. They spent most of their time relaxing by the swimming pool. Mr. Brown had plenty of time, so he walked through the park at a leisurely pace.

definition: one of the pieces of a chain. Each link is connected to the next link. That's what makes the chain.
example: I like the gold necklace with the smaller links. If one link in the chain is broken, we won't be able to lift the engine with it.

definition: something that connects two things together
example: A tunnel under the sea makes a link between the countries of England and France.

definition: an electronic connection between places on a computer. When you click on a particular piece of text or an image it takes you to a new page or to a different place on the same page because there is a link programmed into that text or image.
example: When my mom clicked on the link in her friend's email, it took her to a nice recipe for chocolate chip cookies.

definition: to tie things together in some way
example: The new bridge links the two islands. A wedding links two people, but it also links one family with another family.

definition: to join with or be connected with something else
example: This road links to the highway. That idea links with what I was saying before.

definition: shining; glossy; bright
example: The new snow was lustrous in the moonlight. Her dull graying hair had once been lustrous and vibrantly red.

definition: admirable; splendid
example: Her start on Broadway had been a failure, but she went on to have a lustrous career in the movies.

definition: to damage badly by cutting, crushing, or tearing apart
example: A huge truck backed into their car and mangled its front end. Try not to mangle the milk carton when you open it.

definition: a system of people or things that are connected in some way
example: Sara's mom has a network of friends. They have all known each other since they were in school together. The town library is part of a network of libraries from around the region. The libraries share books and videos with each other.

definition: a group of radio or television stations. Stations that are part of the network broadcast many of the same programs. The company that controls these stations is also called a network.
example: Some television networks in the United States are ABC, CBS, and NBC.

definition: any group of roads or lines that are connected to each other like a net
example: This country has a large network of highways.

definition: a system of computers that are connected to one or more other computers
example: The Internet is the largest computer network in the world.

definition: to create a network for a group of computers
example: The boss networked all the computers in the office.

definition: very great anger. If someone is in a rage, they are extremely angry.
example: Ellie slammed the door in her rage.

definition: something that is very popular at a certain time, especially with people who are always interested in things that are new and different. If something is 'all the rage,' it seems like suddenly everybody wants it or wants to do it.
example: Nobody except farmers and cowboys wore jeans until the 1950s and 1960s when they became all the rage with teenagers.

definition: to act or speak with great anger
example: Max raged after losing the game to his brother three times in a row.

definition: when something like a storm or disease happens or spreads with great strength. A raging storm will usually have strong winds that make a lot of noise and cause damage. A raging disease is one that is serious and spreading to many people in a short period of time.
example: As the hurricane raged, trees were knocked down and roofs were blown off houses.

definition: pieces of broken rock, brick, or other material
example: After the war, nothing was left of the town but rubble.

definition: to walk in a proud or vain manner
example: She strutted down the hallway to show off her new dress.

definition: a strutting step or manner of walking
a light brown color having shades of yellow or orange; tan
having to do with the color tawny
example: His skin is tawny.
